title: Research
text: The phenomenon of international migration of researchers plays a significant role in the globalized scenario, potentially resulting in the flight or acquisition of talent in terms of human capital for the countries involved. This dynamic can affect the socio-economic and innovative development of nations, posing challenges for researchers and policymakers. The aim of this study is therefore to assess the effect of international migration on the academic careers of Brazilian researchers in the field of health, considering the movements made between 2005 and 2020. The database used to achieve the objectives refers to bibliometric data from Scopus, which can be extracted via API. This database contains the information of each article in one line and totals more than 600,000 observations (articles) for the period from 2005 to 2020, for Brazilian health researchers.

title: Research
text: The phenomenon of international migration of researchers plays a significant role in the globalized scenario, potentially resulting in the flight or acquisition of talent in terms of human capital for the countries involved. This dynamic can affect the socio-economic and innovative development of nations, posing challenges for researchers and policymakers. The aim of this study is therefore to assess the effect of international migration on the academic careers of Brazilian researchers in the field of health, considering the movements made between 2005 and 2020. The database used to achieve the objectives refers to bibliometric data from Scopus, which can be extracted via API. This database contains the information of each article in one line and totals more than 600,000 observations (articles) for the period from 2005 to 2020, for Brazilian health researchers.

title: Research
text:
Objectives
The general objective of this study is to evaluate the effect of international migration on the academic careers of Brazilian researchers in the health field, considering the movements made between 2005 and 2020. To this end, it will seek to answer the following question: “Are there differences in the impact and quality of publications by Brazilian researchers before and after the migration movement?”

title: Research
text:
Schedule
The work in partnership with Professor Mine Cetinkaya-Rundel is scheduled to take place between April and July 2024 at Duke University. The stages of the project to be developed during this period are listed below.
Stage 1 - Studies and preparation of databases
Stage 2 - Descriptive analysis and data visualization

title: Home
text:
Leonardo Biazoli (he/him) is Professor of the Actuarial Science at Federal University of Alfenas and PhD Student at the Department of Statistical Science at Federal University of Lavras. Leonardo’s work focuses on causal inference and quasi-experimental models, with an emphasis on impact assessment models (i.e. synthetic control, regression discontinuity and interrupted time series). Leonardo is also interested in the areas of data wrangling and visualization.






BS in Actuarial Science at Federal University of Alfenas (UNIFAL) in 2020
Master’s Degree in Statistics at Federal University of Lavras (UFLA) in 2022
PhD Student in Statistics at Federal University of Lavras (UFLA)
